hobby.message: Urban exploration or just drinking underground?
You bring something banned books with you again?

wrong_hobby_answer: That's not me. In free time, I fly FPV drones. It's a way to escape the noise of the city.
neutral_answer: Yeah, still running late. Too many system checks.
Needed air after a long shift.
You ever tried flying drones indoors? Not worth it.
Been a hassle since all the new rules went up.
Just finished a late drone flight. Too much interference in the yards tonight.
They've tightened the signal bands since the recent blackout.
Makes the hobby more trouble than it's worth.
Still, FPV keeps my head on straight.
Hard to find spots now without getting flagged.
Yeah, ended up losing my whole evening to drone issues.
I fly FPV quads out by Sector H.
Comms blackout ruined my video link—glitches everywhere.
Whole crew showed but nobody flew in the end.
We swapped analog parts just to keep busy.
It’s quieter now, but feels like something’s off.
Hardly slept. Tried drone racing but Directorate’s blackout killed the signal halfway through.
I run home-built FPV quads—usually off-grid, old industrial zones work best.
Lost control mid-flight, nearly crashed into a gantry.
Met others—everyone’s signals were scrambled too.
We traded analog guides, retrofitting transmitters for off-band frequencies.
Feels like someone’s watching, locking us out.
Drone flying was my reset—now it just puts me more on edge.
Exhausted. Spent hours trying to fly FPV drones, but every band’s locked since communications shut down.
I’ve built most of my gear from scrap—teaches patience. Used to lose myself flying under those old towers.
Friday’s flight was wrecked. City signal jammers killed my feed, even analog was spotty.
My group—used to be a community, now it’s like we’re fugitives every time we meet.
We share parts, stories, stay quiet about system audits; risk is part of it.
Strange—none of us trust the BCI now. Feels like it tags us for fun.
I keep flying because it’s the last thing that’s mine.
If they take that too, I don’t know what I’ll have left.
hobby_answer: Yeah. Still fly sometimes.
Not much to say. Signals are unreliable lately.
Spectrum lockdowns ruined most decent spots.
Everyone’s grounded. Nobody talks much now.
Better to keep things low-key.
Still flying when I can.
Harder now with the Directorate’s comms blackout.
Lost video feed last week at Sector H.
People are nervous, fewer regulars show up.
Analog gear works, but it draws attention.
Not the same air out there lately.
Yeah, I still fly FPV drones off-grid.
Last weekend, whole spectrum glitched out. Might’ve been the new blackout.
Lost video and telemetry, had to pack up early.
Flying used to clear my head. Feels tense now.
Most of the usual group just watches these days.
Heard some started rebuilding for analog bands.
Change in the system’s got people spooked.
I still fly off-grid drones whenever I can get a clear channel.
That blackout last week really scrambled everything, even local bands.
Was out by the freight yards when it hit. No warning, just static.
Lost my drone for a minute in the noise—would’ve trashed it if not for failsafe.
People at the site started swapping old manuals, prepping for analog only.
Feels like the system’s watching every frequency now.
We mostly talk in person, keep it quiet.
Not sure how long these meetups will last.
Yeah, still in the habit. Off-grid, industrial zones. Better than therapy, honestly.
Last blackout, my drone lost all contact mid-flight. Could’ve been a real crash.
Used to fly with friends—now most avoid gatherings, worried about flagged signals.
Council says it’s security, but city channels are just surveillance now.
We swap analog parts, repair together, try to dodge bandwidth caps.
Feels like the system wants us grounded—had to reprogram my gear twice this month.
Heard about disappearances linked to flying past curfew.
Feels personal after what happened to my brother.
Honestly, I fly to remember things before all this control. Not sure how long I’ll risk it.
